txt.en: 'I have expected a report these last two days from the Foothold, that is the near encampment of our men in Udûn. A large, well-provisioned force is stationed there, under Captain Lachír, and I can think of no reason for the silence. \n\n'If you pass the Foothold, [placeholder], will you remind them of their duties? My patience grows thin.'
DNT There seem to be few men in the camp for so many tents
You should find someone to talk to in the Foothold in Udûn and remind them of their duty to send regular reports up to High Captain Sador.
The encampment in Udûn, known as the Foothold, has not given any report in two days.
'If you are travelling through Udûn, you cannot help but pass the Foothold. I ask only that you stop as you pass by and remind them they are bound to send me a daily report.'
The Foothold camp is nearly empty
Mulnír sighs.\n\n'Yes, you have my word that we will send a report - just as soon as we have gathered our wits and made sense of this mess.'
'Duties? Ha. You can tell that to Captain Lachír and all the men he took with him. Wherever they are.'
You should visit the Foothold in Udûn and remind them of their duty to send regular reports up to High Captain Sador.
